column1: Yeah about 10 years ago I had a horrifying experience. It was 100% their fault but they hit the water barrels and survived. They had no injuries but they almost ran me off the road.	That sounds pretty scary. What happened?
No I wasn't hit. It turned out they were drunk. I felt guilty but realized it was his fault.	i bet you did!

I don't know I was new to driving and hadn't experienced anything like that. I felt like my horn made him swerve into the water barrels.	Well, can you tell me about your experience? I think we swapped places	That's what happened. I was at the beach and my neighbor was at the pool
Oh my goodness, that's very scary! I hope you are okay now and the drunk driver was punished for his actions?	It's always scary when that happens. I'm glad you're alright!
I there, dont know what to do, jst broke up with my girlfirned, we were 8 years together	i bet that sucks
Yes we decided together with our minds, and know i come home and feel so distant from the world	That is terrible. I hope everything works out for you.
I couldn't wait to go to the concert.	That sounds like fun!
The U2 concert. Tickets were really expensive and I never thought we would be able to go, but somehow we did!!!	Oh, I'm sorry to be rude. I know it's a concert, and it is expensive.
I'm so sad because i've read an article about a newborn girl who died because her parents didn't believe in medication and doctors	That's so tragic. What did happen?

she was born premature at home, she had hard time breathing on her own but instead of taking her to the doctor parents were just praying	I am so sorry for that. I am not sure if you are just being a little dramatic.

yes! And i do believe in God and prayers but goodness gracious please take your children to the hospital and let God heal them THROUGH doctors	so my friend's baby fell down and scraped his knee yesterday and i was trying so hard to cheer him up	That's so nice of you.
i was singing nursery songs :)	That's so sweet of you!  I bet your friend was a little sad, but happy to have someone to take care of his baby and make sure he doesn't hurt.
If you happy and you know it :)	my husband lost a job but i'm hoping he can find a full time job soon	That sucks. What is he doing now?
thank you so much!	That's a tough spot. I hope you're all staying positive!
he is an armed guard	i just moved to this neighborhood and some dumb criminals shot one of my neighbors and ran into the woods!	Oh no! Did they run away?
I do! I want to be able to protect my son	That's terrible. I would do the same thing.
i'm so excited because i'm finally going to visit my parents next month! I didn't see them for 3 years	That's great! What city are you going to?
I moved to the US and they stayed in my homecountry	That's really nice, how long have you lived in the US?

I was very angry when a co worker lied about a car accident to get out of working July 4th. I covered his shift till midnight and he was lying about the accident	That's really bad, you're right though. You could have just let it go
Yeah he got caught in someones pics on Facebook. Never lie and then go out with people who like to take pictures.	That sounds like a pretty crappy situation.  Did you ever see him again after that?

Good idea. i don't like social media that much. It can get you in to trouble fast, even when expressing your opinions.	So yeah i drove 2 hours to get to wallmart. with 299 in my wallet as advertised, and the real price of the tv was 399 usd. what a bummer	I'm sure that was frustrating, but at least they are trying to keep the prices in check.
Yeah i had my hopes reall high and then i left empty handed, such a terrible feeling!	That's the worst. I hate when they do that.

Yes, i guess walmart and the rest of false advertisement in the US, the look in my daugther eyes when i came home empty handed	My friend's boyfriend recently made a pass at me. I'm married, and I also am really good friend's with his girlfriend so I felt really bad. I made sure he knew I was loyal and honest to both!	That sounds awful. What did you end up saying to him?

I struggled with it, but my friend was in a really bad spot, with no income and raising her grandchild, he was the financial supporter. So, I didn't tell her, as I knew it would really hurt her in several ways, plus she really loves him!	I bet she was hurt. But she's probably better off with him now.
my baby is sleeping. it's so peaceful and quiet in this house	I'm happy for you.
i totally agree with you!	I know, it is so peaceful.
hi, i feel so lonely sometimes because all my friends live in a different country	That's a tough one, but I'm sure they will come back around.
i was thinking about it! I wanted to join a group for local moms	I feel that way too. Sometimes I feel like I'm the only one out of all my friends who live out in the country.

I have a friend that has a child that is unruly and does bad things. One day at our home, he grabbed a game and sat on it, instantly breaking it! It was expensive and this really irked me, especially because she doesn't discipline him when he does bad things.	It's hard to discipline kids these days.

Me either! I have two of my own children, and I would have never let them get away with that kind of behavior when they were his age. I just don't understand those kind of parents@!	I know the feeling! I was at the park with my kids the other day and they were running around, playing and laughing, when a little girl started yelling and crying. She was throwing a ball and it was being thrown back and forth, and then she got it and threw it right back at her friend. She then picked up the ball and started to throw it back and forth again and again and again and again and again until it was being thrown right at her friend's face and then
I'm so scared of bugs! i found one in my hair yesterday and almost died	I'm sure it was not a good experience. What kind of bug was it?

Ugh I hate bugs with a passion, they are so creepy	I recently spoke with my ex-girlfriend on the phone. The conversation went pretty well, and it reminded me of my past experiences with her.	That sounds nice. Did she call you?
Yes, they ended somewhat well, but there were tense moments. I am glad she's doing well, but I miss her.	Yeah, it was good to hear from her.
Thank you! That means a lot.	One of the times I remember feeling the most blissed out in life was right after the birth of my first child.	I have two kids myself.  How old is your first child?

Obviously there are the demands of a new child -- but that feeling of finally meeting someone you waited so long for, and the love surrounding the whole situation. Truly something to remember.	I have had two children so far. I think it's the first time for me to have a child, so I am really looking forward to this new experience.

Have you ever been in a situation when payment of some kind has come through *just* in the nick of time?! Talk about gratitude!	That is the most amazing feeling. I once had a payment come in on time and I had just moved to a new city and had just gotten a new job. I was so excited to start my first week, but my new boss had already moved into the office and was already setting up the office. I was in the middle of moving and didn't even have time to unpack. I was so nervous and worried. I was sitting at my desk when I got the call that I had to

Absolutely. You go from scared and desperate to grateful and optimistic in one quick moment! It's not a situation I wish to be in again.	Yeah, it happens a lot in life.  But I have a friend that is always good to me, and I'm grateful every day that I'm in his life.
Im so grateful for my family due to an incident with my friend	I bet. What happened?

My friend lost her parents and siblings in a fire and their family was very close to mine. So seeing her go through the grief made me realize how thankful I should be	That's really sad. I hope she is okay.

Yes definitely. Never take anything for granted as you never know when it will be taken away from you	I'm a big believer in listening to your gut. Sometimes I might wonder where my intuition is leading me, but it always seems to be spot on.	That's really interesting. I don't know what my intuition is leading me but I think I should follow it. I'm not sure I trust myself, though. I'm a little afraid to go with my gut feeling.

It is a "knowing" -- and a flowing! When something is right, it just feels easier to go with it -- like you're being led, even if you might not fully know to where.	That's great! I have to listen more to my intuition too. I've been feeling really overwhelmed lately so I'm taking a step back and doing some self care and meditation.

I couldnt celebrate my 18th birthday as I had exams during the time and I felt terrible for it. But my friends threw a surprise party for me and it was the best!	That's so nice of them. What year did you turn 18?

I was studying in my bedroom for a couple of hours straight with headphones on and then my mom called me to the living room for dinner and when I went out the whole place was decorated and everyone was there	That's awesome! I bet that made the day even better.

I feel lonely sometimes cause I live in a house with 5 girls and all of them have boyfriends and sometimes they are all hanging out with their significant others and I feel lonely	That's a lot of girls.

Sometimes they joke about it and obviously I make it look like its totally fine cause I dont want to give them the impression that I am lonely but it does hurt sometimes	I understand that feeling, but it is a normal part of life.

As silly as it sounds, I was so surprised at how different my two kids were as babies. You're reminded that they're wired with their own personalities from the git-go.	I agree, I remember mine being the same age but they're so different. I'm so proud of them.

One was pacifier, one was fingers. One wanted to co-sleep, one liked her space. One liked facing *out* in the Baby Bjorn carrier, one liked cocooning in a sling!	I can't imagine how different they were. I had twins.

The other day I had a deep craving for Chik-Fil-A.	It is so hard to resist their chicken nuggets!  I had them once for a few years and I was so addicted that my husband had to take the kids away from me and go to the store to get them.  He had to come home and get me because I was in such a bad state!
Mine too. So I drive there and pull in the parking lot and it's completely empty. I then realized it was Sunday.	I am sure it wasn't that empty, I would probably be in there too if they were empty
I visited an orphan once and it was such a surreal moment. It made me realise how thankful I should be for a family	That's a good point, it really made me appreciate my family even more.
Yes it definitely was. I went with intentions to teach the kid a few things but I ended up learning lots more from him	I love kids.  What kind of orphanage did you go to?
My oldest and my husband have always had a rough relationship. I've got to believe that as she gets older, it will get better!	I am sorry to hear about your relationship. I hope that it will improve.

That's always good to hear. But in the moment -- argh, my *heart*. How did your mom maneuver the differences between y'all? Did that wear on her?	It is a hard thing to navigate. I've been there myself.  But I think I can handle myself.  I just want my family to be happy and at peace.

But in the meantime -- the unspoken strain is NOT fun. But I'm glad to hear about a happy ending -- thank you for that!	I can still look back with shame at the way I treated a girl in sixth grade. I wasn't as bad as others, but that doesn't make me feel any better.	I know the feeling.  I was in sixth grade.  I did the same thing to a girl.  I didn't realize what I was doing until I saw her in a different light.  She was in the school's cheerleading squad and I wanted to join.

Well, like a lot of 6th graders I was aware of *not* wanting to be an outcast for any reason. And unfortunately, she was. As an adult of course, my heart squeezes for *all* the kids we were!	I can relate to this. I was a bit of a mean guy as well. I was always looking at the "other" kids to tease and try to get a rise out of them.
Unfortunately, she died. I only found out when Facebook first came out, and her brother and I "friended" one another.	That's really sad. I hope you can find some comfort.
I'm currently working for someone that is *such* a great example of a leader! It makes going into work inspiring every day / every way.	Oh man! What a leader! How cool!  What kind of work does he do?

That's a very kind statement, and certainly what I would strive for. And it's the rarity that *inspires* me. That should be the norm, not the exception! THAT'S what I'd like to inspire in people. How about you?	You are an inspiration!

That is soul-sapping. What do you do to inspire yourself, and not let that kind of behavior drag you down?	I don't really have time to think about that stuff. I'm a busy dad, and my kids are always getting in the way. I'm trying to do the right thing, but I'm just a little overwhelmed and I don't know where to start.
My friend's baby has grown so much since the last time I had seen her!	It's great to see kids grow.  How big is the baby now?
It had been about 8 weeks - I don't get out her way often, even though we live 30 minutes away.	Yeah, that's the life of being a friend, right?

Yes!  I got to be 'auntie' for a bit and help change her and get her fed and down for a nap while my friend had a chance to toss laundry in the wash.  It was a good day for everyone!	Running my first (and maybe only!) marathon felt like *such* a huge accomplishment!	Oh wow! Congratulations! What did you run for?
Ah, it was the best! Plus it helped that I purposely chose an amazing destination in which to run it -- it was the Venice Marathon!	That is so cool!  What did it feel like? Was it hard?

We were living overseas at the times -- the most impressive part was crossing the Grand Canal over a pontoon of boats to finish the marathon ;-)	I bet that was a lot of fun!  I love the Venice Marathon!
I recently found out that a person I very much intimately admired did not feel the same way for me. I was pretty surprised.	That's a bummer. What did you do?
She just started treating me differently all of a sudden. And now she is going to be moving away soon.	That's a tough situation, I'm sorry to hear that.
I'm always appalled when I see bullying in action -- whether it's on a playground or political stage -- not much makes me angrier.	I know the feeling.  It is so hard when it happens.

How do you channel the anger? Obviously, it too easily turns into the same kind of negative emotion I'm upset about -- so that can feel hypocritical!	It is very difficult for me to understand how some people can be so cruel and hateful towards others.  It's hard for me to understand the point they are trying to make.

Are you ever tempted to put anyone's face on the punching bag?! Ha! (Kidding/not kidding!)	One morning my mother came to my house to pick my daughter up for school and told me she saw my daughter's cat on the road and he had been hit. I had to tell my daughter about the loss of her beloved pet.	Oh no! That's terrible! Did she get the best care possible?
She was around 11, so she took it very hard. I went ahead and let her stay home from school, as I knew she wouldn't do well that day.	I am sorry to hear that, I hope she does well.
I was soooo excited to take our kids to Disneyland for the first time!	It is such a fun place to visit. I've always wanted to go. What are you planning on doing?

Same! I was excited because I grew up going there. My grandparents lived in Tucson, and we would spend the summers with them -- the most exciting part being our drive to Disneyland each year!	That is so cool! I wish you had the opportunity to take your kids!

California! Old school ;-) They've kept so much of the original, while adding lots of new attractions.	I recently spoke to my father for the first time in years. It reminded me of my childhood and the distant past.	That is so sweet. What did you guys talk about?
We spoke about our recent lives. Apparently he is in the market for a new car.	That's great. I'm sure that is a big change for you.
Do you like to organize your house.  My mother-in-law recently surprised me recently with some organizing stuff b/c she knows how much I love it!	I do!
Labels and Bins can be your best friend!  Especially with a new baby.	It is so helpful, but sometimes I am so lazy.
I find it odd -- and annoying -- when people don't respond to or even acknowledge emails.	Yeah, that can be annoying, but I think most people don't even check email that often.

It would be great if there was a way we could all tell the best way to reach someone -- I know some people prefer texts to emails -- but if you're in a work situation, how do you ensure communication?	I agree.  It's hard to get anyone to respond to an email, even with the internet.  It's like, it's not like you have to send a letter in the mail to someone.
I recently had a big argument with my sister. We both got very upset and angry at each other.	Oh no! Did it get resolved?
I'm not so sure. We just had a discussion that heated and became an argument with tempers flying.	I'm sorry to say but I've been in a situation like that.
I felt most lonely when we first moved overseas, my husband then had to travel out of *that* country for business -- AND I had a new baby!	Oh that is so sad! How old are the kids?

From Santa Fe to Hong Kong -- ultimately a fantastic adventure. And I ended up with a wonderful group of friends. Expats bond quickly!	Yeah, that's true. I feel lonely when I am away from my family too often.

One of the saddest things to me is when people underestimate what they can do and/or are capable of.	Oh yeah, that is a common problem. People often underestimate themselves, and it's a problem that I've had to deal with many times in my life.

That's perfectly natural. You sound like the kind of person, though, that quickly regained their bearings. Disappointments like that usually come with some *good* lessons.	I'm not one of those people. I think the more you know, the less likely you are to be wrong. That's why you should always trust people, even when they're wrong.

Once my husband asked me not to tell my mom that he was busy that day when she needed his help but I told her anyway.  I really felt bad b/c he got pretty upset with me.	That's not cool. Did he get over it eventually?

Yeah thats a good question.  I totally deserved him being mad.  I just felt bad for him b/c he was so busy that day and I didn't want him to have one more thing on his plate I guess	That's so nice of you.  He probably would have just gotten it out of his system later.  He probably didn't think about how it could be perceived.

There was a back neighbor that called my 10 year old son a ugly name one time, simply because he entered her yard slightly when he rode around the corner.!	Yeah I can't stand that. I'd give him a good kick in the pants and tell him to get off my kid's lawn
Yes, she lived several house back and she didn't know me, until after she did that! She knew me then, but after I talked to her, she apologized to both of us.	That's so rude.
Too often, it's a health scare that makes us value health. It inspires me to try and do something to keep healthy every day.	That's great, you're so positive and healthy!

Happily, I don't have one! It's more seeing family and friends and the situations they're in. Not everything can be helped -- but there are some things we can all do to take care of ourselves, you know?	I am always looking for a new way to help others.

Every time I look through older photos of my children, I'm taken right back to the time they were that size, and what we were doing! It's a bittersweet feeling, for sure.	I love looking back at old pictures! What were they doing?
Are your kids adults now?	You have to admit, that's a good feeling to have, but at the same time, I don't think I'd want to go through those photos again. I'd probably have to cry.

I have an 18 year old as well -- I don't know about you, but it's hard to consider her an adult sometimes!	I have a hard time having confidence in myself but when I got married and I had my hair and makeup done I felt like I was beautiful!  I had so much confidence in myself that day and it was great!	It's a feeling that you've never experienced before, but it's also one that can be very fleeting. I'm not saying it's not something to be proud of, but at the end of the day, confidence in yourself is something that's hard to maintain, especially in the early days of a relationship.
I really try but it's hard to replicate that day for sure.	I can relate to that. I had my wedding done the same way 6 months later.
My husband and I both work for ourselves -- a blessing and a curse at times, since it can be tough to determine a "regular" income.	It can be tough, but it's nice to work for yourself.

We found a pretty good balance in that I have a part-time job that I *love* -- and that comes with benefits like insurance. That's a big worry addressed, right there.	That is great! I love the idea of doing something you love and making money off of it.
I am sorry, because I absolutely know that concern. I truly hope you find a resolution to that.	I met up with an old flame recently, didn't go how I expected	That's unfortunate, did it go well?
Well, right after she gave me a big hug, she introduced me to her new boyfriend.	Yeah, I would hate that too, especially after all the time you've spent together.

I know right! No warning or anything. He turned out to be a nice guy, but I thought it was a little misleading on her part.	My family and I are going on vacation in a few weeks. We rented a largo beachfront condo and I can't wait!	It sounds like a great time! What's your favorite thing to do?
We are going to be staying at Miramar Beach in Florida, about an  hour Panama City Beach. The view is amazing from our balcony and we are so ready!	That sounds amazing! I love the beach!
I was supposed to go for brunch with my friend Maria the other day. At least that was the plan.	Oh, I'm sorry to hear that!  What happened?
Well, we had initially agreed to meet at 11. Wouldn't you know it, she didn't end up returning my text until 3PM!	Oh no! Did she have any excuse?
Me and my mom were at this grocery store recently and this guy started following us outside the store and then again inside the store it was so scary!	I'm sorry, but what happened?

Well I knew he was following us and so I asked the manager to walk us out to the car and when he did we saw the guy come out again from between the two buildings b/c he was waiting on us.  so scary!	Oh wow! That's crazy! What did you do?
Did I tell you what happened with Li the other night? Boy do I feel dumb.	That's so funny. What happened?

She's 45 minutes late to our anniversary dinner. I don't know what happened to me but I called and left an angry message. Turns out, she had gotten T-boned at an intersection and was talking to the Police Officer when I called!	That is crazy. I'm sorry she didn't make it to dinner.
Ugh! I looked like such a fool at my girlfriend's work party!	I bet it was embarrassing!  Did you talk to anyone about it?

Well, I ended up having way too much to drink. One of her co-workers had a bottle of Fireball (gross I KNOW) and was making everybody do shots. I didn't want to look foolish, so I had... well too many.	Yeah, that's the worst!
Did I tell you what happened with the concert I was supposed to go to Saturday?	Oh no, I'm sorry to hear that. I hope you are able to find a replacement concert.
Well first of all, it wasn't just any concert - it was Jay-Z and Beyonce! AND IT GOT RAINED OUT!	I'm not sure if you were kidding or not but I'm not sure if I believe you.
You are never going to guess who was sleeping on the couch when I got home from New York...	That's a good one. Who was on the couch?
My friend Benny! The one we all thought died in a monsoon in Thailand!	I am so sorry, did he hurt?

Recently, my husband came home from grocery shopping and had gifts for me for Mother's Day. He had a beautiful diamond ring and other lovely gifts, it was very unexpected!	Oh, I bet. I love when that happens.
I did! I also gave him unexpected gifts and he was super happy. I was very touched by him being so thoughtful!	It sounds like he really cares about you.  What gifts did he give you for Mother's Day?
I know I shouldn't count my chicks before they hatch, but I'm feeling pretty good after that interview today!	That sounds exciting! What kind of job was it?

This advertising company! The owner was there - you should have seen his face. My last freelance project was a real winner. Think I got it?	That sounds awesome.  I'm a freelancer myself.  You're doing a good job.
Did I ever tell you about the time I "got taken hostage"?	I have never been taken "hostage"

As a heart attack. It was me and Big C at the World's Largest Pistachio. All of the sudden we hear gunshots, and DiDi's still in the car. We ran in the building, and he comes flying in after us. He never pointed the gun at us, and we ended up running away when he was distracted. It's too crazy - I can't make this up. Just glad to be alive!	That's crazy! Did you guys ever catch up with DiDi again?
I went to visit a friend one day and her boyfriend made a pass at me. He actually suddenly kissed me, as I was waiting for my friend to return. I couldn't believe his nerve!	That's so rude of him!

I quietly pushed him away, as I didn't want my friend to hear. I was so shocked and upset, since he knew I wouldn't want to make a scene and took advantage.	That must have been a bit shocking and embarrassing.

This past Friday night our refrigerator stopped cooling! We had to go the weekend without it, and of course had to deal with some unpleasant smells and throw away a large amount of food! It wasn't a fun weekend for us!	That sounds like a nightmare. I bet you were soooo annoyed!

Yes, and of course we tried to call and have someone come out, but to no avail! You don't realize how much you rely on things like that until they aren't working!	That is awful, how did you get rid of the food?
I felt pretty bad when I was having girl talk with my friend and we were talking about our partners. Her boyfriend had made a pass at me, but I never told her about it.	I bet that was awkward.

I felt bad, but she wasn't working and taking care of her grandchild, and her boyfriend was the financial support. I knew it would really be hard on her if she found out, not to mention she really loves him.	That's terrible, she has to be so worried.
I was at the mall and hug my mom and said to her: Time to go Mommy! and i wasnt her, can you imagine my reaction to it?	Oh that's so sweet! Did you guys get to spend time together?

Yes, totally but at the moment i felt like the stupidiest person on earth, didn't know were to hide! and my mom was watching	Yeah, it's pretty funny. I bet you felt like the most awkward person on earth.

THe good thing about it, was the lady, she was laughing and later told me that it has happened to her childrens to, no worries!	I am looking forward to going on vacation in a few weeks! We have a condo reserved on the beach, with fantastic ocean views. I'm ready!	I hope you have a great time!
Well, we are staying at Panama City Beach, so we're right there at the Gulf of Mexico.	That sounds amazing! I've never been, but I've heard it's great.

I am definitely a proud parent of our 15 year old -- she was determined to work this summer, and even with us saying no one would hire her until 16 -- she found a job!	Yeah she's a smart kid, I'm sure she will be a fine adult

That, and she's enjoying the independence of having her own money. Remember that? Making money that you truly could use for your *pleasure* (and not just necessities ?! ;-))	I do, and I'm glad she found it! I'm proud of her too, she's doing well!

Same! I was surprised 15 year olds *can* actually work during the summer. It's just finding an employer who knows those hours get cut WAY back once school starts.	Okay, a silly pet peeve but one nonetheless -- when people just leave their grocery carts willy-nilly in the parking lot. No consideration for others or the people who work at the store!	I know right, I'm always frustrated when people leave their cars and trash on the side of the road.

Me too. And I will always make sure to at *least* put it in one of those cart corrals, if not walk it back up to the store. Hey -- extra exercise ;-)	It's not that big of a deal to me but it really is a big deal to me. I'm always trying to help the store employees with their carts.
WE CAN SAVE THE WOOOOOOORLD!!!!! (lol indeed....!)	I came home, and my wife showed me a picture in 4d of our future baby, my heart speeded so fast!	That's amazing! How old are you?
We choose to wait! but the amount of happiness in my body is tremendous! never felt this way before.	That is so sweet.  I hope you have a baby soon.

Yes, God willing the baby is going to be healthy in every way! can wait to ave the second	I love being in the "flow" -- whether it's in speaking to a group of people or working to help facilitate meetings.	That's awesome!  What kind of flow are you talking about?

I work with different organizations on strengthening their culture, and I do large-scale visual notetaking (also known as graphic recording). Are you familiar with that at all? (Not unusual NOT to be!)	You're an interesting guy.  I've never really been in that type of work, but I'm sure you're a very skilled one.  I'm glad you're doing something meaningful and helpful.  I'm a bit envious that you get to be involved with so many different organizations.  What do you do for work?

That's one of the huge benefits -- learning about many different industries and subjects!	I LOVE when leaders know that it actually *helps* them to be surrounded by strong people -- people they can learn from, that challenge them, and that in some ways could be considered "better".	It makes sense.  I think it's good for a leader to be surrounded by people that are better than themselves.  It makes them look good in front of others.

It's just too many leaders want "yes men" and/or people who feel non-threatening. It's a trap and a quick path to mediocrity, if not failure!	It's so hard to be in a position of power and still not be able to motivate others to do their best work. I wish there was more people out there who are more willing to put in effort to be better than they already are.

I'll always remember the day I learned I was pregnant with our first child -- Halloween in Chicago, and we were with friends at the Shedd Aquarium! I've loved baby belugas since ;-)	I love the way you put your words together!  That was a fun experience to have.
Ha! True that ;-) That's also the year that A Bug's Life came out, and we always thought of our young one as "Dot", the spunky little girl ant in the movie.	That sounds like a fun day.
This mother's day was amazing! I got so much more than expected and it was all so heartfelt	I'm glad you got something you wanted. What was your favorite gift?
Yes, definitely! I actually cried a few times because of how much thought went into each gift and what was written in the cards	I am glad you had a great mother's Day. What were you giving to?
THat's too bad. What do you think went wrong?	I think it was a car accident. The driver didn't follow traffic rules and crashed into a pole.
Did they give you any feedback?	That's too bad, I hope it all worked out.
That is a shame, you need to learn from your mistakes.	I am always looking for feedback. I am trying to improve my performance at work. I am trying to improve my performance at school as well.

So my sister told us a couple weeks ago she was pregnant. Her and her husband are so excited. I hope they have an amazing 9 months and then an amazing time raising the baby.	That's awesome! I've always wanted to have kids.
I was very surprised. She didn't tell a single person they were trying for a baby. Just announced it on the 4th of July	That's awesome!  What's the baby's gender?  I hope she's healthy.

No, the spooky thing is... I think it's the ghost of Michael Jackson. I even saw him dancing to Billie Jean.	It's a ghost. It's just a movie character. I don't believe that.

I can't visit him. I've had to flee the country. We were robbing banks together, and he got caught with half the cash. I'm currently in the Bahamas.	I'm so sorry that happened to your friend.  I'm sorry that you have to go through this.  How long will you have to stay there before you get out?
My son worked for many years to be a footballer, he finally signed a pro contract!	I'm happy for you. What position does he play?
He's just joined Juventus. Can't be more happy for the lad.	That's awesome! I'm a huge football fan and I've always dreamed of playing for the big clubs like Juventus
4 months later he will be here. It has taken me around 3 months to save up enough money to be ready for him when he's born	that's so nice, you must be excited
yes it is. I am very happy	I'm so excited for you.  How many babies do you have already?
only child for now. name is RAIDEN (god of thunder) :D	On my way home from work, a massive bat chased me!	oh wow that's scary!  What were you doing on your way home from work?

I know! This one was absolutely huge, almost human sized. Chased me for a whole hour. The more I think about it, it might have been the batman! I shouldn't have stolen those diamonds!	I think I know where the diamond mine was.
Every day I thank God for my blessings. I'd be in hole right now if it weren't for HIM	That is a good way to think.
especially since he takes care of us even though don't deserve it	That is very nice. I am thankful for everything that has happened in my life.
Once during an important school sporting event, my entire sports team was counting on me but mid-way through my event, my shorts fell down and I tripped	Yeah I've tripped too many times.

yea! it was! I thought everyone would be annoyed at me but the next day when I went back to school, everyone just made it a joke so its alright. This was about 5-6 years ago now haha	Oh my god I remember that!  That sounds like such a disaster!  But you are so right that people are just trying to make light of it!  It is just one of those things that happens and you have to just laugh.  I bet that was a great school experience!  I hope you can still look back and laugh about it!  I can just imagine you tripping and falling and the crowd going "oh no, did that happen?"  haha
I love youtube. been listening to all my classic tracks. Tupac forever	Oh yeah, I love his songs too.
I started out with one hit wonders but ended up at Pac. I miss my youth lol	Yeah I know exactly how you feel. I used to watch all of the Beatles.

When I was younger, my dog died. He was getting up there in age, but he was still on the young side. Later, we heard the pet food we had been feeding him had been recalled because of similiar fatalities.	That's terrible, I'm sorry for your loss
No, they just had a recall. Apparently they didn't clean out their machines properly when making the food, so it got contaminated.	That is terrible. I am so sad for your loss.
Seeing people who have less than me just makes me so grateful for the blessings I have been given	You are very blessed.  You must feel very good about yourself.
absolutely! Always give to people who have less than myself :)	That is so true. I am very grateful for what I have.

hiding for almost 2 years but I'm still not over my paranoia that one day I will have to pay for what I did. Don't ask what it was	I don't know what that is, but it seems like something you did wrong.
no way. I just pray she can forgive me. I could never admit to this sin. Jesus save me	I understand, I'm not sure if I would admit to that one either, but I'm trying to help.

When I was a kid, I went to this group with other kids my age, it was in a big gym. There were kids of different ages, and one of the kids (8 years old or so) was picking on the littler kids. So, when he had his back turned, I looped him with a hoola hoop and tripped him so he fell flat on his face.	That's pretty funny. I bet the other kids were shocked.

Yeah, I was pretty amazed in the moment, he was flat as a board in mid air before he landed flat on his face. I had to watch for a moment in awe, before I realized he was getting up and I was about to get smacked. So, I ran towards where the parents were seated, stopped when I turned the corner, and walked calmly over to my mom, taking a seat on her lap. I looked innocent as could be as the mean kid came around the corner, and I forced myself to sit still so that when he smacked me in the face with the hoola hoop, I looked like a helpless victim.	Oh wow, that's crazy! I'm sorry that happened to you. Did you get in trouble?

after she got her 1st job and new car, she started doing girls night out. Out until 3am one morning. I checked her chat history and sure enough she had kissed another guy >:(	That's not good. I hope she's aware of what she's doing.
jealous isn't the one I felt. I wanted to rip her apart lol	That is pretty gross. I would feel that way if I had my girlfriend doing that with another guy while I was sleeping.

My dad always worked his ass off at a job he didn't like in order to support us, doing a lot of back breaking work as a caretaker. He even had a second job at Wal-mart for a while. I have no idea how he managed to do that sort of thing.	Yeah, my parents always worked a lot too.

Yeah, especially because we were single income. My mom homeschooled my brother and I. I think he took only a handful of sick days his entire time working, had something like 600 days saved up when he retired.	That is awesome that you had your mom homeschooing your brother and you, that is a great thing!
I think he got 3 weeks a year, only used like 5 days.	I would like to see that. I think that's a great way to do it.
my instincts are never wrong. I found out her lies when I checked her facebook chat history.	I hate when that happens
she arranged to meet up with her ex to return his t-shirt! why do that behind my back? we had just started seeing each other. Made me so mad	That's a bit rude. Did you confront her?
I never thought she would tell anyone and make it seem like I did something wrong. I didn't force her	That is very sad.  Did you guys ever get in trouble for it?
ye and so I had to leave the country because of her	I know how that feels. It is very difficult to do something and not get caught.

Public school really sucks sometimes. Making boys shower all together. I didn't want to but had to or else fail PE	I know what you mean. I was always the same gender and was forced to use the boys shower and I was so disgusted by the whole idea. It was such a weird concept.
yes. Well it was a long time ago but I haven't forgotten	That is awful!

My mom homeschooled me when I was little. I was in public school till first grade, but after that I was homeschooled. Did take a semester in grade 11 though to make sure I was up to current standards.	Yeah, that is a good idea.
Really? I didn't even know that was an option. Then again I'm 25 so it may not have been available then.	Yeah, but that's a good thing. It's good you had the chance to learn and grow in a way.

I still haven't got over it. Brandon Lee RIP. I was 17 when I found out he died during filming. I visited the area he took his last steps a couple years ago	That's so tragic. It's so hard to imagine that something that beautiful can be so devastating.
Now the remake is well on its way. Maybe it can lift this depression I feel if they stay true to the story. Jason Mamoa isn't bad looking	I'm sorry to hear that.
I had to adapt to life. I had to change to survive. Now I feel better	That is very wise of you.
I am reminded every day that I can survive anything. A friend gave me a special bracelet (paracord)	I'm glad you are feeling better. What happened to you?
I recently found out a good friend of mine has been cheating on her fiance for years.	I am so shocked and sad. How could someone do something like that?
Very angry and frustrated that she would behave that way. It makes me think less of her as a person.	That's really bad.  How long has this been going on?

I was sucker punched when I was 17. The guy broke his hand and fled the scene. I saw him one time after this riding a bicycle but didn't do anything.	Oh no, that must have been scary. Did you get in touch with the police?
I wasn't confident. Now I regret not punishing him.	That must have been scary.  Did he get in trouble?
I recently completed my masters degree in education at almost 40 years old. I feel really pleased with myself.	That's awesome! What kind of job will you be doing?
Thanks! It was a huge challenge, and I'm SO glad to have it behind me!	It's a great accomplishment.  What are you going to do now?
Being a mom is great, too! And you never know- maybe you'll go back to school in the future! Thanks!	Yeah, I'm glad to have that opportunity too.
I feel happy about the new house I have and that I can work from home. Thanks be to God	That is great news!  Are you moving soon?
It took me 9 months of determination and sacrifice. But worth it.	I am happy for you, it takes a lot of courage to start a new business and work from home. What is the business you are doing?
I blamed myself for her fall because I wasn't close enough to prevent it. I took care of her for months afterwards.	That's good to have that kind of support.
I was distracted by the sound of running water.	That is really nice of you.
I can't get enough of music today. Especially all my songs/bands from when I was in my twenties.	Yeah, I can get a little too into my music too.
Its true though, they can't make good music these days. Not in ANY genre.	Oh, that's true.  I agree.  I used to love my music from my youth, but it just doesn't hold up to the modern world anymore.
I get paid today and I'm getting this new game I've been waiting on to be released!	That's great! Which game?
I'm thinking about getting FarCry 5. I pre-order for the early release! I'm really excited about it.	That's awesome. I'm sure you'll enjoy it.

yes, They thought that I have some extraordinary talent and that is the reason I got that position	Oh wow, congratulations. What position did they give you?

Yes, I am a little uncomfortable driving backwards. I just can't do that.	That's okay. You'll get your license eventually.
every time I try not to hit that cone but those are so close.	I can imagine how you feel when you're driving backwards and you can't avoid that cone.

I still can't believe my life is where it's at, especially if you look at the past few years. I would never believe you if you told me I would be here.	Oh that's a great story, what did you do to get so lucky?

It does. I worked really hard to pass the acceptance tests, and I couldn't believe when I passed with flying colors!	Oh wow! Congratulations! That is awesome. What are you studying?

lol thats funny	My hubby lost his job a couple of months ago but he has an interview this friday so i pray he will get that job	I hope so too. I hope it works out for him.
armed security	I hope so too!  I'm so proud of him.  You guys are so lucky to have each other!
I stayed alone at night in a office due to excessive work and was much scared.	That's a bit scary. Was it a scary place?
no, I was on a 10th floor and security was down. I was scared even with a single noise.	I am sorry you had to stay alone.
I have been awarded with a degree in marketing.	I love that.  That is very nice of you.
it took 4 years but at last got it	That's great! Congratulations!
Yeah,  I have  a job that I was looking for and now I am really enjoying my life.	Hey, have you ever been in a car wreck?	i have been. it was scary

I was in one about 2 years ago. No one was hurt, but it totaled both of our cars.	That is a scary thing. I have never been in one. I am always driving around with my kids. I am sure it was very scary.
Have you everr been in a fist fight with anyone?	I have, and I have no regrets about it.
I got in a fist fight with my step father once. It wasn't a fun experience as you can imagine.	Oh man, what happened? Did he beat you?
Have you ever played and old video game called Everquest?	I haven't, I'm a gamer but I haven't played one in years. I think I would be really interested in it. What's it like?

It came out in 1999. I used to play it when i was a teen. I installed it the other day and had a good time playing.	That sounds like a fun game! I've played a lot of MMORPGs over the years, and I'm always looking to try out new ones. What did you play the most recently?
Have you ever eaten at Hardee's?	I haven't but I've heard it's pretty good.
I like it too, but I'm not a big fan of their new sliders. They're so tiny, and just one of them cost almost 2 dollars!	I love hardees. I have never had any problems with the sliders.
Have you ever had a sleep paralysis dream?	I have. It is so creepy.
Yeah, in mine I saw a smoke looking shadow over me with red eyes staring at me. I've never been more scared in my life.	I have. It's the most terrifying thing.
Have you ever rode on a roller coaster?	It is a very exciting experience.

I hate riding them, but i used to machine components for their drive chain when I was a machinist.	Yeah, I have. It's really fun. I've always been fascinated by the idea of how it works, but I'm not sure I'd ride one again.

A while back my friend's boyfriend tried to get me to have an intimate relationship with him. He knew I had been married a very long time, as well as he was in a relationship with my friend. I turned him down flat, as I love my husband very much.	That must've been difficult for him.
Yes, I let him know that was wrong and disgusting. I couldn't believe he did it!	That's terrible. What happened to him after you said no?
Yes, as I am honest with him. But, I didn't want trouble.	I'm going overseas and I think I packed everything i need!	It is good to have a backup.  I have never left the US before.

Going to Kazakhstan. That's where i was born. My parents still live there and i miss them so much	Oh wow, that sounds amazing! I've never been to a foreign country before, so I can't wait to hear about all the things you see and experience! What are you planning on seeing?
Hi, My girlfriend was recently let go of her job, but she put so much work in to finding a new job and got one with better pay!	That's really cool, I bet she was happy.
Yes I agree, she was so happy when she found out the job was hers	That's great! I'm so happy for you and your girlfriend. I bet she's very happy to have found the right job for her!

She wasn't really fired, her position was no more. Schools don't have much room left for Home Ec teachers. Sad	I agree, I think schools need to hire more people. I am a teacher and I am not getting any younger.

Yeah she has a passion for teaching. These kids will be great to work with.	So about a year ago now, my girlfriend decided to surprise me with a puppy!	That is so cool!  Did you know she was going to get one?
Yes, so nice!! It was the best thing that could've happened! It's a German Shepherd!	Oh wow. That is nice. I have a German Shepherd too, and a Poodle, and a Bearded Collie, and a Beagle.

There was this one time I was fairly drunk at a bar and this attractive girl was trying to make moves on me, but I did my best to ignore it all.. Having a girlfriend and all.	That's a bit weird, but I guess it's okay if you're not interested.
I was very proud definitely when I woke up the next morning and knew no mistakes were made!	Oh wow, what happened after that?
There was this one time my girlfriend and I had plans to meet a Longhorn steakhouse for a date.. She ended up keeping me waiting inside 30 extra minutes! I was pretty frustrated.	Oh no. That's awful.
Yes, she actually had a legit reason so I couldn't be too mad at her.. She definitely made it up to me!	That's a bit of an unusual reason for waiting, but at least she was trying.
I'm just so happy it's finally Friday!	That is awesome!
i just want to sleep in and then watch movies all day long... but i'm a mom so i don't sleep in. ever	That's nice. I have to work. I don't get to sleep in.
I had to cancel a trip to see my brother after it started snowing heavily.	That's too bad. Snow is the worst.
Yes, when the snow builds up on the road I get nervous, and during this trip I couldn't even see where the road was and where the ditch began.	That is terrible. You should have stayed home.

It sure can.  When I decided that I wasn't comfortable driving in such deep snow I literally turned around and went home.	I'm glad you went home.  It is not safe to drive in deep snow.  I would not go out in that kind of snow either.
When my parents got divorced when I was a kid, it was one of the hardest things for me.	I'm sorry to hear that. I hope things have worked out for them in the end.
It does definitely get easier over time I suppose.. Now that I see my life I guess it was for the best.	I'm sorry you had to go through that. I know it was tough for me.
Just the other day my girlfriend and I were getting ready for the beach, but right before we left it started to pour rain.	That is so not cool. I'm sure you're both disappointed.
Well, when looking outside you could see a clear patch in the distance... So we kinda just hoped for the best to wait it out.. We finally did get to go!	That is so cool, did you get wet?
There was one day after work that my girlfriend was planning a surprise party with a bunch of friends and family.	That's awesome. What was the surprise?
Yes, the party was for me! I was so shocked and had no clue it was coming.	I'm glad you were surprised. What did you do?
There was this one time I stole a shirt from my friend, and I feel pretty guilty about it.	I hate doing that, but sometimes you have to do what you have to.
Because I really liked it, and didn't think he'd care.	I'm glad it was your friend. What did he do?
My girlfriend recently went on a business trip for a week, I was very lonely during this experience.	I bet it was lonely! Did you stay in touch?
I mainly just played video games and watched tv.	I can't imagine being that lonely.
I moved to a new apartment and they didn't accept my dog breed, so I had to give her up. :(	I'm so sorry! That's terrible. I hope she is okay!
Because here in my area in Florida, there isn't too many options for me.	I understand, it is hard to find a place with pets.
My mom doesn't have a ton of money, but last christmas she made sure to get me some awesome things!	That's very nice of her!
She got me a brand new laptop I had been wanting for gaming!	That's awesome! I'm glad she was so excited about it.

I went on this ride at the beach called the Slingshot.. It shoots you super high up in the air.. It was so teriffying, I had so much faith in the ride I wouldn't die!	Oh that sounds like fun. I love the thrill of it.
It was seriously so scary, I almost pooped myself!	It's so fun to do!

There was this time I went to the bar with my girlfriend and once I came out of the restroom, I saw her talking to some guy!	It's always a little awkward after the bathroom, but it's nothing to worry about!
Well I get super jealous and angry of course.. But in the end it was just a work friend.. Oops!	That's a good thing you didn't go home that night, you can always go back there the next time.
My dog randomly got up on my couch last week, and just started peeing.. Like what!?!?!??!?!	Oh my gosh. Did you try to get him back up?
Not since lunch, so it's actually been about 4 hours.. I hate living on the top floor!	That is so gross! I have had to get rid of dogs before.
I finally graduated college last year, it felt like it took SO long!	That is great! I graduated a few years ago and it took forever. What did you study?
Yes, I am so proud of myself for finally accomplishing it!	It's nice that you made it, I'm sure you will have many more adventures in the future!
My girlfriend saw me kissing another girl, who was kissing ME at the bar.. I was very drunk..	I bet you felt bad for her.  What did you do?
No.. I realized the mistake I made and took action so it never would happen again.	That is so bad. What happened next?
There was this one time I was driving down the road, and this guy on a sports bike popped a wheelie.. It was so sick!	Yeah that sounds like fun! Did you stop and try to catch him?

I know! I do too.. I think I need to learn to ride a sports bike first.. Hehe oops!	Yeah, I love watching that type of video. It's so cool to watch! I think it's time for me to learn how to ride a sports bike first.. I don't think my car is safe enough for that haha!
When i was younger, I came back to the house with my family to find our family pet dead.	That is terrible! What happened?
He was very old, so I guess we were all expecting it.. He lived a good life!	That's so sad. What happened to him?
My dog chewed a hole in my carpet 2 weeks ago.. I was very disgusted to say the least!	Oh no! That's terrible. Did you have to call a carpet cleaning service?

Oh dang, I guess I can't complain too much then, that's brutal!	That's so gross!  I've never had to deal with anything like that before.  Did it happen to your dog too or did it happen to a different dog?

I have to go to confession at the church... i was a little mean to my mom, sometimes its difficult to be always nice	Yeah, I think it is okay to have a few flaws and not be perfect. But I can see why you would be upset.

Well yes when i shouted and i inmeaditelly apologize but i feel really bad	That is so understandable. You can't be mean to your mom.  I'm sure she is a good person and you are going to make things up to her.  I am sure she will forgive you.
We walked, we ate ice cream, we rode a bike, we laughed a lot, we enjoyed the outdoors, we were exhausted	I love ice cream!
I had time that I did not share with the children and that was something that was pending in my soul	Oh wow! What a lovely day it was!  Did you go on a picnic?
Sometimes one gives priority to work	The world is very beautiful	It really is.  I have a lot of friends from my hometown and it brings me back to my childhood.

Exactly. Look at the beautiful scenery around you. Nature at its very best. I am surprised people don't notice	I agree with you. I am so tired of the people who don't appreciate the beauty of the world around them.

People are getting busy everyday with other stuff and they forget to breathe fresh air. Leads to s stressful life	I can remember feeling so disillusioned when someone who I really admired as a visionary turned out to be a real jerk on a day-to-day basis.	That's a good way to put it. It's like when someone you admire is a politician and they turn out to be corrupt and greedy. I can't believe that they would be able to do such things.

Well, it definitely makes you a little more realistic when you may be tempted to put someone on a pedestal. Not really fair to them *or* to yourself, is it?	It's hard to deal with that. I hate when people do that. I wish they would just be honest and tell you how they feel.

As a kid, I was SO frightened any time there was a tornado warning. Not sure if it was the Wizard of Oz effect or what -- I just remember being frozen with fear.	Yeah, I'm sure it was the same with you. I was too young to know the difference.

That's the thing -- NO! I mean, there were some that were kind of close -- but NOTHING like what so many folks have to deal with. I just remember wanting a basement sooooo badly -- not something that's common where I grew up!	It's so scary, but I hope it never happens to you!

My mom said the best thing once when I was babysitting and a tornado warning went off and I didn't want my own fear to affect the little boy I was with -- she was on the phone and just said "You have big plans for the future, right? Nothing is going to get in the way of that." For some reason, it worked a charm ;-)	That is very kind of her. I hope that she's happy.

I feel so bad when I think back to times that I got angry and yelled at my kids for no real good reason -- just a combination of the day's events and feeling irritated, really.	That is the worst.  I hate when I get angry.  I am so bad.

Yes! THAT I feel good about! Making a point to use it as an opportunity to talk. I've definitely used it when it comes to the way others might act -- emphasizing that it's not about *them*, it's really about the person and where they're at.	That's really great. You have to be patient and understanding.

I do look at that as a strength, in anyone. Being able to say "I'm sorry" and "I made a mistake."	I was SO excited the first time we were going to make an overseas move! I looked so forward to what I knew would be a life-changing adventure!	That's awesome. I bet it was fun!
I highly, highly recommend it. Not always easy -- culture shock *is* a thing! -- but such a great way to enhance one's perspective.	I'm so glad to see you're not afraid to be honest.
i would fear my gift	I am so jealous! What is it?
my partner gave me a an i phone it is very memorable and pleasure to me	That is very interesting. What did your partner give you?
yes but its a valuable gift to me	Yeah, that's what I'm saying.  I was really happy when she gave me an iPad.

yeah but this gift is definitely different for me	I have such an amazing husband! He works so hard so i could stay home with our baby	That's awesome. I have a husband too. I'm so jealous of the life you have.
he is an armed guard	That is so cool that he's in the armed guard! What kind of work does he do?
I have a pretty bad vision so i'm so scared to drive at night	I'm sorry to hear that, but I'm sure you can drive safely at night.

yes, i even have glasses but because of astigmatism i don't see good at night even when i have glasses on	I am sorry to hear that, you should get a pair with a better lens and get a new prescription, you will feel much better.

It seems like today everyone in the grocery store was in such a rush. Hurrying around!	I know, I felt like I was going crazy trying to get my groceries and the kids were running around like crazy. I was so stressed!

Yes! They cut in front, and bump into you. Plus being rude while they do it	I agree, it is so frustrating when people are so in a rush they can't even notice you. I hope they will learn to slow down soon!

I'm so sleep deprived and my baby wanted to play in the middle of the night and i just yelled at him :( i feel so terrible	That is the worst.  I feel bad when my kids are playing and I'm trying to sleep.
i love being a mother but sleep deprivation is so horrible	That's awful. You have to get your sleep back. You need to start taking care of yourself.
I love being around them and it's great to see them each year.	I love the holiday season.
O I'm sorry, my niece and nephews, only seem in the summer. Do you get company during the summer?	I do get company in the summer, I have 2 dogs that go on walks with me.
My kids are going into 7th and 8th grade in a couple weeks. They really are growing up well	I bet. What are your kids doing in 7th and 8th grade?
My oldest daughter has some learning disabilities so I'm really proud of how she is doing. They're both growing up so fast	It is so cool to see how kids are growing up
i paid all my bills today, i feel so relived and good	That is so great! I have a lot of debt myself but it's always good to pay it all in one day. What bills did you pay?
rent and electricity. we've been struggling financially so it's such a relieve to pay bills	That's awesome. I've never paid all my bills at once. I'm jealous. What kind of bills did you pay?
I studied so hard for my bar exam so that I could become a lawyer. I prepared for almost 3 months straight!	That's great! What's it for?
I did pass! It was a rough 3 months, but once I got there, I felt like I was ready.	I hope you passed and got your license.
I was about to book a flight for my baby and i and i was so surprised to find out i didn't need to pay for my baby'sticket	That's so cool. I have a friend who had to do that.
i know! now i can spend the rest of the money on something cool	That is great news! I hope everything goes smoothly.
my husband called me a punk today for no reason. and then when i told him he hurt my feelings he didn't even understand why	That's not very nice of him!
no.. i love him. but he can be such a punk sometimes	I can understand how that would hurt.  I hope you can talk things out with him.

When I was younger, I got my driver's license. I was sooo scared to drive, because i didn't want to get into an accident.	Oh yeah, that's a pretty common problem for a lot of people. I'm not sure I'm ready to drive yet, but I'm hoping to get my permit soon.

I tried to tell myself that, but my dad got into a really bad accident once, and it has scared me ever since.	I know that feeling! It's like you are always looking around and waiting for something bad to happen!
I recently started learning to propagate my tomato plants by planting clipped off branches.	Oh, that's really cool. I've always wanted to try that. How's it going so far?
Yea, i put them in a glass of water for a week or two and they grow their own roots, wasn't expecting much.	I am so proud of myself.
I do yes! and since the method i used is working, i have tons of tomatoes!	I would be amazed! I never thought about growing tomatoes in water. What kind of tomatoes did you have?
Around town it seems like traffic has been horrible lately. Driving around town is just crazy.	That's a bummer. Do you drive or do you walk?
